paragraph: Lodewijk Rudolf Arthur Parisius (July 23, 1911 in Hannover, Para District, Suriname â€“ December 14, 1963) was a Surinamese/Dutch tenor saxophonist commonly known as "Kid Dynamite." He was noted for mixing jazz with Surinamese kaseko. He also supported Coleman Hawkins's popularity in the Netherlands. He died in a road accident in Germany.
Website about the history of Dutch jazz (in Dutch)
